text: Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
author: Unknown

text: Success doesn’t just find you. You have to go out and get it.
author: Unknown

text: The harder you work for something, the greater you’ll feel when you achieve it.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: Great things never come from comfort zones.
author: Unknown

text: Dream it. Believe it. Build it.
author: Unknown

text: If you get tired, learn to rest, not to quit.
author: Banksy

text: You are stronger than you think.
author: Unknown

text: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t stop until you’re proud.
author: Unknown

text: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

text: Little by little, one travels far.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
author: Plutarch

text: Don’t wait for opportunity. Create it.
author: Unknown

text: You are confined only by the walls you build yourself.
author: Andrew Murphy

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: Don’t limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
author: Unknown

text: Your limitation—it’s only your imagination.
author: Unknown

text: Sometimes we’re tested not to show our weaknesses, but to discover our strengths.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
author: Bo Bennett

text: The key to success is to focus on goals, not obstacles.
author: Unknown

text: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Don’t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Push yourself again and again. Don’t give an inch until the final buzzer sounds.
author: Larry Bird

text: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Work hard in silence. Let success make the noise.
author: Frank Ocean

text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Don’t wish it were easier; wish you were better.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Opportunities don’t happen, you create them.
author: Chris Grosser

text: Your passion is waiting for your courage to catch up.
author: Isabelle Lafleche

text: Dream bigger. Do bigger.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t wait for the perfect moment. Take the moment and make it perfect.
author: Zoey Sayward

text: Sometimes later becomes never. Do it now.
author: Unknown

text: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
author: Robert Collier

text: You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Do what you can with all you have, wherever you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: What seems to us as bitter trials are often blessings in disguise.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

text: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
author: Charles Kingsleigh

text: Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: Don’t be afraid to fail. Be afraid not to try.
author: Michael Jordan

text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Be so good they can’t ignore you.
author: Steve Martin
